name: Americas Best Value Inn & Suites / Hyannis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I recall the Summer rates at this motel were $150.00+ now the off-season rates are $54.00+. As I checked in on the 08SEP08 I inquired if I was eligble for a discount knowing that I work for the only large employer on Cape Cod. I was told "aren't the rates low enough for a single room?" my response was " I will be the judge of that."
reviews.title: More reviews listed under Best Value Inn Hyannis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I live off Cape Cod and as always, I am amazed that tourist and visitors to Cape Cod have to put up with the substandard choices for accomodations and I don't forsee that ever changing unless new competition of budget-moderate motels/hotels ie: La Quinta, Holiday Inn Express, Hampton Inn ETC spring up.
reviews.title: excellent value in centre of Hyannis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $54.00 is not a lot of money for a motel on Cape Cod/Hyannis but could I possibly have matching furniture, non-golden girls floral bedspreads with matching curtains and please put a dust ruffle on that stained box spring.
reviews.title: good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value as a base for visiting Cape Cod. Our room had been updated - fresh paintwork, very comfortable bed, good bathroom and shower. A bit of noise from heavy footsteps above but this was inevitable in a motel style building. Good continental breakfast - juices, hot drinks, cereals, breads, bagels, muffins. Fine indoor swimming pool heated to a satisfactory temperature. Restaurants/shops within walking distance. Free wifi worked very well.Overall, highly recommended as a base for visiting Cape Cod at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Got what we paid for, as advertised.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a comfortable room and the water pressure for the shower was good.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: nasty nasty nasty. this best value inn was not a best value. i did not want a 5 star hotel, but i do expect cleanliness. the rooms the previous folks were talking about must be the renovated rooms. i did not have that. I encountered numerous problems, and was met with an attitude by the staff that told me i should have left the first night. i stayed because there was no where else to go, but i WOULD NOT recomend this place to anyone. the lobby was clean and inviting, the rooms, not so much. only good point was the location and the bagels in the morning. fittied sheets, by the way, 'are not standard' in hotels. who knew. i admit the pricepoint is low, but remember, there is a reason for it good luck
reviews.title: not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most horrible hotel experience I've ever had. The sheets on the bed looked as though they had never been changed from the previous guest. The sheets were crumpled under the spread and loaded with "hair". The bathroom smelled and had hair in the sink on the floor, and in the tub. The shower curtian was full of mildew and the towels (once white) were off grey. The air conditioner was loud and did not cool the room sufficently. We were only staying for one night but I ended up at Bed Bath & Beyond to buy new sheets for the bed and towels so I would not have to use what was provided. I also bought soap because the soap they supplied was a joke! When I made the reservation, I asked about coffee makers in the rooms and was told that there were none but that coffee was available in the lobby at all times. When I went to check out at 6AM the lobby was closed and no coffee! We only paid $65/night - I guess you get what you pay for!
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were planning a short getaway to Cape Cod. With having done a lot of internet research into where to stay, we picked Hyannis, as it is the mid point of activity on the Cape.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL FOR THE $

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price was a big consideration, and after much research we decided to book at the Best Value Inn and Suites. Prior to booking, I applied online for a Americas Best Value saving card (free to apply) to save 15% off our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

likes.disliked: — shower head...watersaver that blows a lot of air.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived June 20, and booked for 3 nights, total cost $211 USD.
reviews.title: Hard to get anything better that this motel for the money I paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I must say the value here is unbeatable anywhere in Hyannis and I certainly do appreciate that. The people who run the Best Value Inn are nice, hardworking individuals. They will treat you with the same respect you give them. More than often, you will see the staff interacting and having good laughs with their guests.
reviews.title: The Best Value Indeed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: The property itself is a bit older but the place is clean, comfortable and quiet at night. Almost all of the guests were out of town, all being couples or families. I met a nice couple from Montreal one day and a funny guy from Baltimore the other night.
reviews.title: very good for price

likes.liked: — close to ferries and manager very nice and helpful
likes.disliked: — toilet flush twice and waited awhile for water to heat for the shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the ground floor and were close to both pools. The indoor pool was huge and best of all, it was HEATED. It felt like a big jacuzzi. After a long day of running around to places in the Cape, I went to soak in the indoor pool at night. The outdoor pool was a bit colder but who cares, it was near 90 degrees the days we were there. The water at both pools were blue, clear, and clean-looking. That was a big plus because it kept the kids entertained.
reviews.title: good value for location and price

likes.liked: — Close to the Nantucket ferry and the price was great
likes.disliked: — No electrical outlets in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room itself was VERY clean. The housekeeping staff did a great job on keeping the room tidy during our stay. There were two beds in the room, fridg, microwave, and a big TV. It was nothing fancy but very comfortable and suitable for our needs. The bathroom floor seemed to have new tiling.
reviews.title: stay elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning, there was breakfast from 8am - 10am. My only complaint is that they should start the breakfast earlier. It was a bit crowded when the breakfast room opened but started to die down later on. Fresh bagels, donuts, waffles, and juice/coffee were served. There was also bananas and eggs too. One of the better continental breakfasts I have seen.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: i am actually shocked to see some reviews putting down this place. i just returned 2 days ago and thought the best value inn was a perfect stay for me and my family. the rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. some of the furniture is dated but it is very clean. i have travelled all over the us and found this hotel to be very very adequate for my needs. i am a stickler for cleanliness and this place is definitely CLEAN contrary to past reviews. i even talked to some of the guests while at the outdoor pool. no one appeared to be dissatisfied with their room or stay. everyone was happy as they should be because we were all on vacation afterall. the staff are a friendly group of people who always seem so energized. they are very easy to talk to and they know the area pretty well. the hotel itself is pretty busy so if you're looking for reservations in the summer, please book ahead of time so you're secured. i guess, since the place has quite a number of rooms and appears to be busy everyday, there will always be a bad apple or two who just like to complain for no reasons. if you're looking for a place to enjoy the cape, this is the place to be. it's conveniently located right in downtown hyannis. the harbor and ferries are a stone's throw away (1 block) and the main streets shops and restaurants are at your doorstep. if you're looking for a five star hotel with all the glamour and frills, do yourself a favor and book somewhere else. if you're just like me who just needs a clean, comfortable place to relax and enjoy the cape....then you won't be disappointed in staying at the best value inn. thank you best value inn for the great stay.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel in Hyannis

likes.disliked: — nothing i can think of right now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at this motel for two nights. I booked this motel based on the prior reviews on this website. I have to say I was pleasantly very surprised at how great it was. We booked a king size bed and the room was very clean. We checked in about an hour early without any problems. The room was cleaned without any incidents on Day 2. The room was very quiet and I had no trouble sleeping. The bed was quite comfortable. This motel also has a very nice indoor pool which was very clean and well kept. We took advantage of that both days. There is also an outdoor pool which we did not use, but it was open and looked fine as well. Most people there were families and the few twenty-somethings were quiet and respectful. A few people were smoking cigarettes outside on the balcony in chairs that the motel provides, but that did not bother me. The parking lot had plenty of space and there is no additional cost. The best part about this property is that you can walk to most things in Hyannis from here (including the ferries to Martha's Vinyard/Nantucket), as it is right on Main Street. It is true that there is no outlet in the bathroom but the room had a hair dryer in the main room. The bar soap they provide is a bit small, but I think you could get more if you asked. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: An Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I always make a trip to the Cape at least once a year, and we have been staying with America's Best Value Inn for the past 3 or 4 years. I've never been one to write online reviews, but after such a great weekend in Hyannis, I wanted to share my thoughts. This hotel is family-owned (the family is very hardworking and always very friendly!), and I noticed all of the renovations that have been made to improve the hotel over the years. Some of the things I noticed were new doors, new signs throughout the hotel, and my favorite -- the new coffee and juice machines in the breakfast room! We stayed for three nights, and had breakfast EVERY morning.
reviews.title: They keep us coming back!

likes.liked: — GREAT location and value, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I got a King, non-smoking room, which was very comfortable. We always returned to a nice, clean room each evening (thank you housekeepers!) The hotel also has a huge indoor pool, which we loved to relax in after our adventurous days.
reviews.title: Not recommended

likes.disliked: — Dirty bed sheet. Not clean at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Usually my husband and I stick around Hyannis and the nearby towns, but this time we decided to visit Martha's Vineyard on our last day. The gentleman at the front desk was very nice and helped us plan our trip. He checked the weather for us, and we were able to purchase the tickets at the hotel. We left our car at the hotel and actually walked to the ferry because it was so close!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I recall the Summer rates at this motel were $150.00+ now the off-season rates are $54.00+. As I checked in on the 08SEP08 I inquired if I was eligble for a discount knowing that I work for the only large employer on Cape Cod. I was told "aren't the rates low enough for a single room?" my response was " I will be the judge of that."
reviews.title: Substandard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I live off Cape Cod and as always, I am amazed that tourist and visitors to Cape Cod have to put up with the substandard choices for accomodations and I don't forsee that ever changing unless new competition of budget-moderate motels/hotels ie: La Quinta, Holiday Inn Express, Hampton Inn ETC spring up.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: $54.00 is not a lot of money for a motel on Cape Cod/Hyannis but could I possibly have matching furniture, non-golden girls floral bedspreads with matching curtains and please put a dust ruffle on that stained box spring.
reviews.title: fight for your right to cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pics to follow.
reviews.title: worse than terrible

likes.disliked: — Everything! Lack of cleaniness, lack of a safe crib for my child...

reviews.title: Great place to wait for ferry
reviews.text: I booked this motel based on the location and value, but after reading reviews I was scared to stay here! In reality, it actually was not as bad as I had imagined that it would be. The furnishings are very worn and ugly, but it seemed reasonably clean. The location was great for walking around downtown Hyannis in the shops and restaurants. The breakfast was not great (just bagels and muffins) but not too bad for being free! Overall, it was a fine place to stay for one night (and great for catching the ferry), but not some place I would want to stay for an extended period of time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed in Hyannis for 1 night with my partner, on our extended trip around Europe & the USA. It was the end of the summer season & cooling off a little, but we were still able to visit a lot of the town & surrounding areas, & enjoyed ourselves a great deal.
reviews.title: Excellent budget hotel in the beautiful Cape Cod area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked our accommodation via the hotel directly, & confirmed a place to stay for the duration of our holiday. On our arrival (via car) we found the hotel easily & parked at the front, where there is space to leave your vehicle while you check in. The hotel is at one end of the Main Street, just a few minutes from everything, & very close to the shops even if you are walking. We were given room 50, & drove into the main car park – there are loads of parks here, near the swimming pool (which was closed, as it wasn't warm enough for swimming). Our room was quite nice & fairly spacious – we had a king-sized bed, a small fridge, TV (with Sky), table & chairs, & our own bathroom – everything was in good condition & the shower was hot with plenty of water pressure. Wi-fi internet access was available for free, & breakfast was provided – it mostly consisted of bagels & coffee, although there was a little bit of variety. It was nice & fresh, but the breakfast room only had 4 tables in it, & we couldn't find anywhere to sit, even though the complex was pretty quiet. If you come in the summer season or with a group then you may need to take your food back to your room to eat it.
reviews.title: A great deal for you $$$

likes.liked: — You get a lot for your $$$
likes.disliked: — Maybe a little more counter space but that isn't very crucial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was in good shape, with free coffee in the lobby. There were lots of maps & information on offer, & the service was OK. This hotel would suit people of all types, including older visitors or large groups (the complex has 86 rooms in total, from what we could see). It was excellent value for money & the rooms were more than satisfactory. The hotel is so close to the shops, & within just a couple of minutes drive of the beach & beautiful surrounding areas.
reviews.title: fantastic value love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, if you are after a cheap, clean & comfortable hotel, then this is the place for you. If we are ever back in the Hyannis/Cape Cod area then we would definitely return here. Thanks for a nice stay!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here early Oct for 2 nights. Clean room with fridge and a great shower. Free parking and superfast wifi connection. The only draw back was that there is not a lot of counter space in the bathroom and the room for you to lay out things. Free breakfast has bagels, toasts, muffins, cereals, milk, juices, coffee & tea. No hassle check-in and check-out. There is a little convenient store within a 5 min walk. Even though it may appear that the inn is "cheap-looking", it really does offer a great deal given we only paid an average of $55 a night. Walking distance to shops and dining on Main Street. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean and simple

likes.disliked: — There were some kids running around on the balcony and it woke me up one morning.

aka: Americas Best Value Inn And Suites / Hyannis
description: Seasonal Property- Open April 15th thru October 31st, Americas Best Value Inn and Suites Cape Cod is a wonderful 2 floor, 84 guestroom property conveniently located in Hyannis, the heart of beautiful Cape Cod. Our tastefully decorated guestrooms offer modern in-room conveniences and quality amenities for the comfort of our guests. The name says it all - comfortable and quality accommodations at a valued price. Perfect getaway for couples and vacationing families. Relax and enjoy the value. We are centrally located in Downtown Hyannis' "famous Main Street Waterfront District". Our hotel is a short walk to Hyannis Harbor, ferry services to Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket, Cape Cod Scenic Railroad, the Kennedy Memorial, the beautiful beaches, and wonderful Main Street shopping which has waterfront dining. Our inn is the best value for clean and comfortable rooms in Cape Cod. Enjoy our gigantic indoor heated pool and outdoor pool with a sundeck. Guestroom amenities include wireless internet, refrigerators, premium cable TV, telephones, air conditioning, and a complimentary breakfast. You'll find it all at Americas Best Value Inn and Suites. We're right on Main Street in Hyannis, the very heart of the Cape...always close to the sights and sounds that make a visit to this wonderland a perennial joy artists' colonies and museums, stores and charming antique shops, restaurants, movies and summer theaters, churches. Everywhere there are meandering roads and picturesque villages. Nearby are challenging golf courses, boat rentals, and superb fishing facilities. Fine, safe beaches on Lewis Bay and Nantucket Sound are mere moments from our door. One stay and you will come to realize what others already have and what has made Americas Best Value Inn so welcoming for so many. So book with Americas Best Value Inn and Suites in Hyannis today.
